metadata.title: CVE-2019-3992 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: ELOG 3.1.4-57bea22 and below is affected by an information disclosurevulnerability. A remote unauthenticated attacker can access the server'sconfiguration file by sending an HTTP GET request. Amongst theconfiguration data, the attacker may gain access to valid admin usernamesand, in older versions of ELOG, passwords.

criterions.comment: elog: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
